meanings.definition: to act in an excessively subservient manner
meanings.sent1: He was kotowing to his boss in hopes of getting a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She was kotowing to the celebrity, asking for an autograph.
meanings.sent3: The dog was kotowing to its owner, wagging its tail eagerly.
meanings.sent4: The politician was kotowing to the voters, promising grand changes.
meanings.sent5: The student was kotowing to the teacher, always volunteering to help.

meanings.sent3: The cat was kotowing to the new kitten, letting it play with its favorite toy.
